Name: Requiring the administration for children’s services to publish demographic data and incident reports on youth detained and placed in its juvenile facilities.
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the administration for children’s services to publish demographic data and incident reports on youth detained and placed in its juvenile facilities, and to repeal chapter 2 of title 9 of the administrative code of the city of New York, relating to the department of juvenile justice.

Be it enacted by the Council as follows\ulnone :\par
\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\fi720\sl480\slmult1\qj Section 1. \cf1 Chapter 2 of title 9 of the administrative code of the city of New York, as added by local law number 12 for the year 2010, is REPEALED.\par
\cf0\'a72. Chapter 2 of title 9 of the administrative code of the city of New York, as added by local law number 14 for the year 2010, is REPEALED.\par
\'a7 3. Section 21-901 of the administrative code of the city of New York, as added by local law number 20 for the year 2006, is amended to read as follows: \par
\caps\'a7 \caps0 21-901. Definitions.\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi720\sl480\slmult1 Whenever used in this chapter, the terms set forth below are defined as follows:\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\fi720\sl480\slmult1\qj\ul\ldblquote Abused child\rdblquote  means a child or youth who has been subjected to \ldblquote physical abuse,\rdblquote  \ldblquote sexual abuse\rdblquote  and/or \ldblquote psychological abuse\rdblquote  as defined in section four hundred eighty-eight of the New York state social services law while in the custody of ACS.\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi720\sl480\slmult1\ulnone [1.] "ACS" means the administration for children's services, or any successor agency charged with operating the city's child welfare system.\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\fi720\sl480\slmult1\qj\ul\ldblquote Bias-based incidents\rdblquote  means incidents, including fights or altercations between a child and another child or staff, that arose in whole or in part due to a child\rquote s perceived or actual sexual orientation, gender expression or gender identity, as reported by such child.\ulnone\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi720\sl480\slmult1 [2.] "Case worker" means a diagnostic child protective specialist assigned to a zone.\par
\ul\ldblquote Child\rdblquote  means \ldblquote youth\rdblquote  as defined in this section.\par
\ulnone [3.] "Commissioner" means the commissioner of ACS.\par
\ul\ldblquote Detention\rdblquote  means the temporary care and maintenance of youth held:\par
1.  away from their homes pursuant to article three or seven of the family court act; or\par
2.  pending a hearing for an alleged violation of the conditions of release from the New York state office of children and family services or ACS facility or authorized agency; or\par
3.  pending a hearing for an alleged violation of a condition of parole as a juvenile offender; or\par
4.  pending a return to a jurisdiction other than the one in which the youth is held; or\par
5.  pursuant to a securing order of a criminal court if the youth named therein as principal is charged as a juvenile offender; or \par
6.  pending a hearing on an extension of placement; or \par
7.  pending transfer to a facility upon commitment or placement by a court.\ulnone\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\fi720\sl480\slmult1\qj\ul\ldblquote Detention facility\rdblquote  means a facility, certified by the New York state office of children and family services, for the care of youth detained in accordance with the provisions of the family court act, regulations of the New York state office of children and family services, and the criminal procedure law.\ulnone\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi720\sl480\slmult1 [4.] "Entry order" means an order entered pursuant to subdivision two of section ten hundred thirty-four of the family court act to enter specific premises where there is probable cause to believe an abused or neglected child may be found.\par
\ul\ldblquote Fiscal year\rdblquote  means the fiscal year for the city of New York.\par
\ulnone [5.] "IRT investigation" means an instant response team investigation conducted pursuant to the Administration for Children's Services and Law Enforcement Instant Response Teams Protocol dated February 1998 or any protocol hereafter promulgated that sets forth guidelines for the use of interdisciplinary instant response teams.\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\fi720\sl480\slmult1\qj\ul\ldblquote Limited secure placement facility\rdblquote  means a placement facility characterized by physically restricting construction, hardware and procedures which are less restrictive than the construction, hardware and procedures of a secure placement facility.\par
\ldblquote Mechanical restraint\rdblquote  means the use of a mechanical device to restrict the movement or normal function of a portion of a child\rquote s body, including but not limited to, handcuffs, leg cuffs, daisy chains or waist restraint.\ulnone\par
\ul\ldblquote Neglected child\rdblquote  means a child or youth who has been subjected to neglect as defined in section four hundred eighty-eight of the New York state social services law while in the custody of ACS. \par
\ldblquote Non-secure detention or placement facility\rdblquote  means a detention or placement facility characterized by the absence of physically restricting construction, hardware and procedures.\ulnone\par
\ul\ldblquote Physical injury or impairment\rdblquote  means any confirmed harm, hurt or damage resulting in a significant worsening or diminution of a child's physical condition.\par
\ldblquote Physical restraint\rdblquote  means the use of bodily force to limit a child\rquote s freedom of movement during a physical confrontation or to prevent a confrontation.\par
\ldblquote Placement\rdblquote  means the temporary care and maintenance of adjudicated youth held away from their homes pursuant to article three of the family court act.\par
\ldblquote Placement facility\rdblquote  means a facility, certified by the New York state office of children and family services, for the care of youth placed in accordance with the provisions of the family court act and the regulations of the New York state office of children and family services.\par
\ldblquote Room confinement\rdblquote  means the confinement of a child in a room, including but not limited to the child\rquote s own room, when locked or when the child is authoritatively told not to leave.\par
\ldblquote Secure detention or placement facility\rdblquote  means a detention or placement facility characterized by physically restricting construction, hardware and procedures.\par
\ldblquote Youth\rdblquote  means a person who resides in a juvenile detention or placement facility in the custody of ACS.\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi720\sl480\slmult1\ulnone [6.] "Zone" means one of no fewer than 13 divisions of ACS child protective services headed by a deputy director who exercises oversight over the work of child protective managers, supervisors and child protective specialists in a specific geographic area, or the Office of Confidential Investigations.\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\fi720\sl480\slmult1\qj\'a7 4. Chapter 9 of title 21 of the administrative code of the city of New York is amended by adding a new section 21-905 \cf1 to read as follows:\cf0\par
\ul\caps\'a7\caps0 21-905. Demographic Data. \par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\sl480\slmult1\ulnone\tab\ul a.  Admissions to Detention Facilities.\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi720\sl480\slmult1\tx990\tx1080 1.  By September 30 of each year, ACS shall post a report on its website regarding the total number of admissions in the previous fiscal year to the following facilities:\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi720\sl480\slmult1\qj i. secure detention facilities; and\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi720\sl480\slmult1\qj\tx990 ii. non-secure detention facilities.\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\sl480\slmult1\ulnone\tab\ul 2.  The data provided pursuant to paragraph one of subdivision a of this section shall be disaggregated by the following factors:\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi720\sl480\slmult1\qj\tx990\tx1080 i.   age;\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi720\sl480\slmult1\qj\tx1080 ii.  gender; \par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi720\sl480\slmult1\qj iii. race; \par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi720\sl480\slmult1\qj\tx1080 iv. zip code of residence, except that for a number between one and five admissions from one zip code, the number shall be replaced with a symbol;\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi720\sl480\slmult1\qj v. for youth remanded to a detention facility by a court, the most serious charged offense on the court petition, complaint or indictment at the time ACS assumed custody; and\par
vi. for youth brought to detention by police, whether the top arrest charge was a misdemeanor or a felony at the time ACS assumed custody.\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\li720\sl480\slmult1\qj b.  Demographic Data for Detention Facilities.\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi720\sl480\slmult1\qj 1. By September 30 of each year, ACS shall post a report on its website regarding the average daily population in the previous fiscal year in the following facilities:\par
i. secure detention facilities; and\par
ii. non-secure detention facilities.\par
2.  By September 30 of each year, ACS shall post a report on its website regarding the number of youth admitted to a detention facility during the previous fiscal year who spent time either in non-secure detention only, secure detention only, or both non-secure and secure detention, disaggregated by the following factors:\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi720\sl480\slmult1\qj\tx990 i.   age;\par
ii.  gender; \par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi720\sl480\slmult1\qj iii. race; \par
iv. zip code of residence, except that for a number between one and five admissions from one zip code, the number shall be replaced with a symbol; \par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\fi720\sl480\slmult1\qj v. for youth remanded to a detention facility by a court, the most serious charged offense on the court petition, complaint or indictment at the time ACS assumed custody; and\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\fi720\sl480\slmult1 vi. for youth brought to detention by police, whether the top arrest charge was a misdemeanor or a felony at the time ACS assumed custody.\ulnone\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\fi720\sl480\slmult1\qj\ul c.  Admissions to Placement Facilities.\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi720\sl480\slmult1\qj 1. By September 30 of each year, ACS shall post a report on its website regarding the total number of admissions in the previous fiscal year to the following facilities:\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi720\sl480\slmult1 i.  non-secure placement facilities; and\par
ii. limited-secure placement facilities.\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\sl480\slmult1\qj\ulnone\tab\ul 2. The data provided pursuant to paragraph one of subdivision c of this section shall be disaggregated by the following factors:\par
\ulnone\tab\ul i.  age;\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi720\sl480\slmult1\qj ii. gender; \par
iii. race; \par
iv. zip code of residence, except that for a number between one and five admissions from one zip code, the number shall be replaced with a symbol;\par
v. youth who were detained at a detention facility immediately prior to being ordered to a placement facility by a court pursuant to the family court act;\par
vi. youth who were not detained at a detention facility immediately prior to being ordered to a placement facility by a court pursuant to the family court act;\par
vii. youth who were transferred to an ACS placement facility from the custody of the New York state office of children and family services in accordance with subdivision six of section four hundred and four of the New York state social services law; and\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi720\sl480\slmult1\qj\tx1080 viii. for youth ordered to a placement facility by a court, the most serious offense adjudicated against such youth by the court.\ulnone\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\li720\sl480\slmult1\qj\ul d.  Demographic Data for Placement Facilities.\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi720\sl480\slmult1\qj 1. By September 30 of each year, ACS shall post a report on its website regarding the average daily population in the previous fiscal year in the following facilities:\par
i. non-secure placement facilities; and\par
ii. limited-secure placement facilities.\par
2.  By September 30 of each year, ACS shall report on its website the number of youth admitted to a placement facility during the previous fiscal year who spent time either in non-secure placement only, limited secure placement only, or both non-secure and limited secure placement, disaggregated by the following factors:\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\sl480\slmult1\qj\ulnone\tab\ul i.  age;\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi720\sl480\slmult1\qj ii. gender; \par
iii. race; \par
iv. zip code of residence, except that for a number between one and five admissions from one zip code, the number shall be replaced with a symbol; and\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\fi720\sl480\slmult1\qj v. for youth ordered to a placement facility by a court, the most serious offense adjudicated against such youth by the court.\par
e.  Data on Transfers.\par
1.  By September 30 of each year, ACS shall post a report on its website regarding the total number of youth who have been transferred during the previous fiscal year from:\par
i. a non-secure detention facility to a secure detention facility;\par
ii. a secure detention facility to a non-secure detention facility;\par
iii. a non-secure placement facility to a limited secure placement facility;\par
iv. a non-secure placement facility to a secure placement facility;\par
v. a limited secure placement facility to a non-secure placement facility;\par
vi. a limited secure placement facility to a secure placement facility;\par
vii. a secure placement facility to a limited secure placement facility; and\par
viii. a secure placement facility to a non-secure placement facility.\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi720\sl480\slmult1\qj 2. The data provided pursuant to paragraph one of subdivision e of this section shall be disaggregated by the following factors:\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\fi720\sl480\slmult1\qj i. age;\par
ii gender; and\par
iii. race.\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi720\sl480\slmult1\qj f. Interim Reports.\par
1.  On or before September 30, 2013, ACS shall post a report on its website regarding the total population in non-secure placement facilities as of the last day of every month during the previous fiscal year.\par
2.  No more than one year after ACS begins operating limited secure placement facilities, ACS shall post a report on its website regarding:\par
i. the total number of admissions to such facilities in the first nine months of their operation, disaggregated by the following factors:\par
(a)  age; \par
(b)  gender;\par
(c)  race; and \par
(d) youth who were transferred to an ACS placement facility from the custody of the New York state office of children and family services in accordance with subdivision six of section four hundred and four of the New York state social services law;\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\fi720\sl480\slmult1\qj ii. the total population in such facilities as of the last day of every month during the first nine months of their operation; and\par
iii. the number of youth admitted to such facilities during the first nine months of their operation who, during that period, spent time either in non-secure placement only, limited secure placement only, or both non-secure and limited secure placement, disaggregated by the following factors:\par
(a)  age; \par
(b)  gender; \par
(c)  race; \par
(d)  zip code of residence except that for a number between one and five admissions from one zip code, the number shall be replaced with a symbol; and \par
(e) for youth ordered to a placement facility by a court, the most serious offense adjudicated against such youth by the court.\par
\ulnone\'a7 5. Chapter 9 of title 21 of the administrative code of the city of New York is amended by adding a new section 21-906 \cf1 to read as follows:\cf0\par
\ul\caps\'a721-906. \caps0 Incident Reports.\par
a. Quarterly Incident Reports.\par
1. Within sixty days after the end of each quarter of the fiscal year, ACS shall post a report on its website, based on data from the previous quarter, that shall contain the number of the following incidents:\par
i. use of physical restraint by staff on children; \par
ii. physical injuries or impairment to children as a result of the use of physical restraint; \par
iii. use of mechanical restraint by staff on children;\par
iv. physical injuries or impairment to children as a result of the use of mechanical restraint; \par
v. fights and altercations between children; \par
vi. physical injuries or impairment to children  as a result of fights with other children; \par
vii. physical injuries or impairment to children resulting from any other means not previously mentioned;\par
viii. biased-based incidents as reported by a child; and\par
ix. the number of room confinements and the length of stay for each confinement.\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi720\sl480\slmult1\qj 2. The data provided pursuant to paragraph one of subdivision a of this section shall be disaggregated by the following factors:\par
i.   each secure detention facility;\par
ii. non-secure detention facilities;\par
iii. non-secure placement facilities; and \par
iv. limited secure placement facilities.\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi720 b.  Annual incident reports.\par
\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi720\sl480\slmult1 1. Within sixty days after the end of each fiscal year, ACS shall post a report on its website containing the following data:\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\fi720\sl480\slmult1\qj i. the number of allegations made during the fiscal year that a child in a detention or placement facility was a neglected or abused child; and\par
ii. the number of findings made during the fiscal year by the New York state office of children and family services substantiating allegations that a child in a detention or placement facility was a neglected or abused child, including findings that substantiated allegations made prior to the fiscal year.\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi720\sl480\slmult1\qj 2. The data provided pursuant to paragraph one of subdivision b of this section shall be disaggregated by the following factors:\par
i.   each secure detention facility;\par
ii.  non-secure detention facilities;\par
iii. non-secure placement facilities; and\par
iv. limited secure placement facilities.\ulnone\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\fi720\sl480\slmult1\qj\'a7 6. This local law shall take effect immediately, provided that:\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\sl480\slmult1\qj\tab a. the requirement to report on admissions data regarding limited secure placement facilities described in subparagraph ii of paragraph one of subdivision c of section 21-905, as added by section four of this local law, shall take effect in the report due by September 30, 2015; \par
\tab b.  the requirement to report on the average daily population in non-secure placement facilities, as described in subparagraph i of paragraph one of subdivision d of section 21-905, as added by section four of this local law, shall take effect in the report due by September 30, 2014;\par
\tab c.  the requirement to report on the average daily population in limited-secure placement facilities, as described in subparagraph ii of paragraph one of subdivision d of section 21-905, as added by section four of this local law, shall take effect in the report due by September 30, 2015;\par
\tab d. the requirement to report on the number of youth admitted who spent time either in non-secure placement only, limited secure placement only, or both non-secure and limited secure placement, as described in paragraph two of subdivision d of section 21-905, as added by section four of this local law, shall take effect in the report due by September 30, 2015;\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\fi720\sl480\slmult1\qj e.  the requirement to report on transfers, as described in subdivision e of section 21-905, as added by section four of this local law, shall take effect in the report due by September 30, 2014;\par
f.  the requirement to disaggregate incident data by limited secure placement facilities, as described in subparagraph iv of paragraph two of subdivisions a and b of section 21-906, as added by section five of this local law, shall take effect in the report due by September 30, 2014; \par
g.  the requirement to publish data regarding bias-based incidents that occur in detention and placement facilities, pursuant to subparagraph viii of paragraph one of subdivision a of section 21-906, as added by section five of this local law, shall take effect in the report due by September 30, 2014; and\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\sl480\slmult1\qj\tab h. the requirement to disaggregate data by youth transferred to an ACS placement facility, as described in subparagraph vii of paragraph two of subdivision c of section 21-905, as added by section four of this local law, shall expire three years after it shall have become a law.\par
Notwithstanding the preceding sentence, the requirement to report on limited-secure placement facilities shall not take effect until such facilities have been operational for a period of three months.\par
